summary: This is an internal NSD (National Security Division) Daily News Brief from December 11, 2017, warning staff about media outlets reporting potentially classified documents. It includes a summary from the Attorney General's News Briefing reporting that Fusion GPS sought to link then-President Donald Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, in addition to the Russia dossier.

keyFacts: The document is an internal government briefing warning staff about media outlets potentially publishing classified information.
It reports that Fusion GPS, in addition to the Russia dossier, pitched stories to journalists attempting to link Donald Trump to convicted pedophile Jeffrey Epstein.
Fusion GPS founder Glenn Simpson reportedly pushed the idea of a close relationship between Trump and Epstein.
The document notes Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in 2008 to soliciting sex from an underage girl.
The briefing also mentions Fusion GPS pushed a story about a special email server between Trump Tower and Moscow's Alfa Bank.
